name: Chile Morita Salsa
description: This salsa is a little bit different than your average grocery store find. It's a chile morita salsa and it is very smoky and tangy.

recipeInstructions.text: Place tomatillos, onion, and garlic cloves on a sheet tray lined with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Place tomatillos, onion, and garlic cloves on a sheet tray lined with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Broil in oven for 10 min. The tomatillos will begin to blacken and soften. After the first 10 min. remove the garlic and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Broil in oven for 10 min. The tomatillos will begin to blacken and soften. After the first 10 min. remove the garlic and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Flip the tomatillos and the onion over. Put back in oven. Broil for 10 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip the tomatillos and the onion over. Put back in oven. Broil for 10 more minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Boil water in a small sauce pot. Take the stems off of the chiles and remove the seeds. Add chiles to the boiling water and turn down to a simmer. Let simmer for 15 min. Drain and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Boil water in a small sauce pot. Take the stems off of the chiles and remove the seeds. Add chiles to the boiling water and turn down to a simmer. Let simmer for 15 min. Drain and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: If using a blender, place all the ingredients in blender until you have reached the desired consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: If using a blender, place all the ingredients in blender until you have reached the desired consistency.

recipeInstructions.text: If using a molcajete, start off by peeling the garlic and grinding it to a paste with the salt. Add the onion and continue to grind to a paste. Add the chiles and continue to grind. By now you should have a thick red paste.
recipeInstructions.name: If using a molcajete, start off by peeling the garlic and grinding it to a paste with the salt. Add the onion and continue to grind to a paste. Add the chiles and continue to grind. By now you should have a thick red paste.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the tomatillos one at a time and keep on grindin’ until the skins dissolve. At this point if the salsa is too thick you can add a little bit if water to loosen it up. Season with salt and pepper.
